text.name: sys_description
text.text: The APF-MP1000 is a console produced by APF Electronics, released in 1978. It is equipped with a Motorola 6800 8-bit CPU and 1KB of RAM. It can display a resolution of 256x192 in 8 colors, and has a built-in speaker. The two controllers included controllers are wired directly to the machine, including a joystick with 12 buttons each. It runs games from cartridges but featured a built-in game: Rocket Patrol. It was very close to the capabilities of its competitor, the Intellivision.
